author: D Madhavan
text:
Iron girders installed on the stretch to prevent entry of heavy vehicles

Street lights were installed on Madras Water Canal Road in Korattur on Sunday —Photo: K. Pichumani

A decade-long struggle of Korattur residents finally ended on a happy note on Sunday with Chennai Corporation officials providing street lights on Madras Water Canal Road.

Officials have placed iron girders at the entry and exit points of the stretch, to prevent heavy vehicles from using it, ensuring the safety of a British-era conduit pipeline beneath the road.

The pipelines are over a century old and supply water from the Chembarambakkam lake to Kilpauk Water Works. Treated water from here is supplied to the residents of Chennai.

Recently, The Hindu had highlighted the plight of Korattur residents in the absence of street lights.

A team of officials from the Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board and officials from Corporation’s Ambattur Zone inspected the spot and began work on the iron girders and street lights.

“Street lights on any stretch gives a sense of security, especially for women who return from work,” said Deepa Thyagarajan, a resident of Korattur.

title: Street lights finally come to Madras Water Canal Road
